content.title: Riyaayati Dar Par Copies Ka Vitaran
content.details: The 'Riyaayati dar par Copies Ka Vitaran' scheme initiated by the Labor department of Madhya Pradesh with the aim to provide financial assistance to the children of the construction worker. It will reduce the financial burden and help to educate their children.
eligibility: Applicant construction workers should be employed in industrial units/establishments falling within the circle's jurisdiction.
The benefit extends to a maximum of two children per worker.
It is mandatory for the concerned worker to deposit the amount of copies in the board through the institute.
content.application_process: Applicant need to reach the below office: Regional Officer (Public Relations Officer, Contribution Collection Officer, Welfare Officer, Welfare Supervisor, Welfare Inspector). Get the prescribed format, fill out the required details and submit. Applicant need to deposit the cost of copies with the managing institution. Upon approval, the copies are distributed to the children through the institution.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Labor department of Madhya Pradesh state started the scheme 'Riyaayati dar par Copies Ka Vitaran' for the children of construction worker.

faqs.question: Who can get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Children of the construction worker will get the scheme benefit.

faqs.question: Is there a Caste-related eligibility criteria in this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no caste-related eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can other state person apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: How many children from a same family can get the benefit?
faqs.answer: Only 2 children of a family are eligible to get the benefits of this scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for construction worker?
What is the time period to apply for the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, Within 30 days from the publication of inviting applications under the scheme.
